Content: Agama never saves the seed. You can only encrypt it with password or PIN in lite mode. Without the seed you will not be able to access the funds.

Author: Dr Debt#0891
Content:
Error
Can't broadcast transaction
the transaction was rejected by network rules. Missing inputs

Author: Dr Debt#0891
Content: anyone knwo what this is?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: It can happen because of a wrong timeclock setting , also try sending the balance to the same public address it could help with the mix of UTXOs in that particular address for that specific transaction .

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: let me know if this guide helps , https://komodoplatform.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/KPSD/pages/288620545/Transaction+rejected+by+network+rules+Time+Clock+Error+Agama , or if sending the balance back to the same public address helps with the UTXOs and then lets you send the transaction that you need.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: if that doesn't help please send us a ticket at support@komodoplatform.com so that we can review this 👍

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Can someone explain how Einsteinium will use dPoW, if they don’t use a Komodo chain? How it works exactly?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its a code change to the consensus of the coin.... basically it checks for valid notarizations, and then creates a checkpoint in the chain, and they chain can no longer be reorged back past that checkpoint.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: effecivly making a private mining 51% double spend attack almost impossible. In my #private-staked project I am working on, we are using a very fast frequency of notarizations, I doubt it is even possible to 51% attack that coin at all, but we are still in testing phase... I don think frequency that fast is going to be somthing we can take to mainnet.

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Wow, the answer was faster than my question...;)

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Than can use every other coin this service without being on a Komodo chain? I didn’t realize how that worked. The own code of Einsteinium is changed? it is not an „API“?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It requires a hard fork in the code to achaive it yes. I guess every coin could use it. I am working on creating a way to have 3rd party notaries, which is almost done and in testing phase, as the main KMD notaries will eventually reach a limit of how many coins they can handle at once.

Author: Seko#7408
Content: How does Komodo benefit? By payments for the service?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: free marketing 🤷

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no point creating something open source if nodody uses it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: all notarizations transactions pay an address called the CRYPTO address, anyone who notarizes to KMD has to pay that assset KMD.

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Is Komodo than running on Einsteinium? Is it than a Komodo chain? Or only a change in the own code?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I am not 100% sure on the specifics, and i dont think the code is even finished... Their coin will remain their own coin as I understnad it, they will just have a Hard fork to implement the code chainge.

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Thank you, that is helpful...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no problem... Spent the last few weeks figuring out how it all works myself. Really cool stuff 😄

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Genius...🤙🏽

Author: Seko#7408
Content: Better for the ecosystem is a migration to Komodo. Do you agree?

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Hi, could someone please point me to where I can find what the `-ac_params` for KMD are?  (Sry, not sure where to post this.)

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Hi @CrisF KMD blockchain params you can get from `getinfo`. Why you have to start Komodo like this, not just `komodod` without params?
I've runned daemon as `komodod -ac_name=KMD` and `komodo-cli -ac_name=KMD` calls instead of just `komodo-cli` worked for me to interact with Komodo chain

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Thanks, @TonyL .  I knew there must be an easy place to find the info.  Just couldn't think of it 😉

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: It's not for running it, I just want some more example params to play around with and make a test chain with.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Thought KMD would be a good example.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Actually I think I've misinformed you a little bit regards `getinfo` since misunderstood you, sorry 😃 It's actually getting a state for user.
https://docs.komodoplatform.com/komodo/example-asset-chains.html here you can find a lot of useful examples of different ACs starting

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Thanks, yeah, I've been looking at those.  I'd like to see what KMD would look like written with params and use that with the docs to sort it out in my head.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@CrisF  Have to be something like this:
`komodod -ac_name=KMD -ac_supply=100000000 -ac_reward=300000000  -ac_end=7777777` 
 100000000 premine, 3 KMD reward per block, 100000000 more have to be mined,
but not 100% sure about the math

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: The magic seven

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Thank you both!
